Description: Marl clay pottery bowl with flat base and flaring sides, drawing in slightly towards rim. The rim is painted with a brown line and the interior is decorated with brown-painted finger-spots. Exterior trimmed on lower body.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D16A in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxx) ((grave register))
